page.title: 12HOUSING
page.content: Most of the houses in the villages are traditional, there are few modern houses. The High Street, Meonstoke is a conservation area and includes only 3 modern houses.New properties are usually only permitted when in-filling or replacing derelict properties. This conservation area is about to be extended. Most of the old houses in Meonstoke High Street post date 1719 when much of the village was destroyed by fire.Exton has its own conservation area.There are four groups of council housing. St.Andrews Green and Niton Cottages, Meonstoke, were built in 1947.16 bungalows for the elderly and 9 houses were built in Pound Lane between 1960 and 1975. Exton has 4 council houses. Niton Cottages and several others are now privatly owned.
